intro: Glenniea penangensis, commonly known as the Penang glenniea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, with hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
